subject: test collector for junit under ant?
msgSnippet: What s the best practice for collecting junit tests and running them within an ant build?  I definitely don t want to hand-create a suite, and I d prefer to
messageBody:
What's the "best practice" for collecting junit tests and running them
within an ant build? I definitely don't want to hand-create a suite,
and I'd prefer to not have to depend on a naming convention. Is there
an easy means to pick up all the tests in a particular source tree? Or
compile the test source to a different classes directory and pick up the
tests there? What are people using for this?

- George

--
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Hope your road is a long one. George Dinwiddie
May there be many summer mornings when, gdinwiddie@...
with what pleasure, what joy, http://www.Alberg30.org
you enter harbors you're seeing for the first time;
from 'Ithaka' by C.P. Cavafy
